fields.headline: Yesterday
fields.bodyText: Bad day Liberal Democrat MP Paul Burstow is repaying £1.20 for House of Commons stationery which he used for an election fund appeal, against parliamentary rules. The MP for Sutton and Cheam "inadvertently" sent six letters to constituents on headed notepaper telling them he needed another £1,500 towards the cost of printing his election address. Today Commons: Health questions. Budget debate, final day. Terrorism Act 2000 (proscribed organisations) (amendment) order 2001. Lords: Debate on foot and mouth outbreak.
